metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3628 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel Broadcom Full MACWi-Fi driver. This issue occurs when a user connects to a malicious USBdevice. This can allow a local user to crash the system or escalate theirprivileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3628` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required
